description: This notification indicates the status of the last/current
download operation.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::downloadImageTrap EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageSlotId i 9999 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageStatus i 1 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageFilename s EXAMPLE EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImagePartition i 1 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageStartTime s EXAMPLE

description: Specifies the MSM/MM module number of a switch or the slot number currently being
used by the active stack node.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageSlotId

description: Specifies the status of the current down load operation.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageStatus

description: Specifies the file name of the downloading EXOS image.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageFilename

description: Specifies which partition the image should be saved
to primary or secondary. Select primary to save the
image to the primary partition and secondary to save
the image to the secondary partition.
Note: Beginning with ExtremeXOS 12.1, an ExtremeXOS core
image must be installed on the alternate (nonactive)
partition. If a user tries to install on an active partition,
the error message [Error: Image can only be installed
to the non-active partition.] is displayed.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImagePartition

description: Specifies the start time (date and time) of the current down load operation.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeDownloadImageStartTime

description: This notification indicates the status of the last/current
install operation.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::installImageTrap EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageSlotId i 9999 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageStatus i 1 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageFilename s EXAMPLE EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImagePartition i 1 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageStartTime s EXAMPLE

description: Specifies the MSM/MM module number of a switch or the slot number currently being
used by the active stack node.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageSlotId

description: Specifies the status of the current install image operation.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageStatus

description: Specifies the software image file.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageFilename

description: Specifies which partition the image should be saved
to: primary or secondary. Select primary to save the
image to the primary partition and secondary to save
the image to the secondary partition.
Note: Beginning with ExtremeXOS 12.1, an ExtremeXOS core
image must be installed on the alternate (nonactive)
partition. If a user tries to install on an active partition,
the error message [Error: Image can only be installed
to the non-active partition.] is displayed.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImagePartition

description: Specifies the start time of the current install operation.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeInstallImageStartTime

description: Change in status of System Power
The trap will not be generated for discovering state.
A textual description of the entity. This value
should include the full name and version
identification of the system's hardware type
software operating-system, and networking
software. It is mandatory that this only contain
printable ASCII characters.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr

description: The current state of power available.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSystemPowerState

description: Some event took place in the system
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeGenericTrap EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::severity i 1 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::eventName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::message s EXAMPLE

description: The severity of the message being sent.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::severity

description: The event name being sent.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::eventName

description: The message being sent
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::message

description: Trap to indicate change in status of Power Supply.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremePsuPowerStatus RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremePowerSupplyNumber i 9999 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremePowerSupplyStatus i 1

description: A textual description of the entity. This value
should include the full name and version
identification of the system's hardware type
software operating-system, and networking
software. It is mandatory that this only contain
printable ASCII characters.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr

description: Power supply number.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremePowerSupplyNumber

description: Status of the power supply.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremePowerSupplyStatus

description: Whenever the power usage is increased/decreased by the configured
threshold value then the power usage trap is generated if the trap is enabled..
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSystemPowerUsageNotification RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime t 31536000 RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSystemPowerUsageValue i 9999 EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSystemPowerUsageUnitMultiplier i -24

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: A textual description of the entity. This value
should include the full name and version
identification of the system's hardware type
software operating-system, and networking
software. It is mandatory that this only contain
printable ASCII characters.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr

description: The current power usage of the system.In stack mode this variables tells total power usage
of the entire system.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSystemPowerUsageValue

description: The magnitude of watts for the usage value in extremeSystemPowerUsageValue.
variables.name: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB::extremeSystemPowerUsageUnitMultiplier
